title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 28): Public Art Collaboratives as Power With - Reclaiming Space, Story, and Solidarity
summary: A guide to creating collaborative public art projects that reclaim space and amplify collective voice through horizontal coordination and shared authorship.

Community.summary: Use collaborative art-making to strengthen community bonds and reclaim public space for collective expression.

level0: Form a small group of neighbors and storytellers interested in creating together
Host story circles to identify what needs to be remembered or reclaimed
Practice collaborative decision-making in planning sessions
level1: Establish group agreements for shared authorship and decision-making
Identify meaningful sites for art intervention in your community
Build participatory design process involving community input
level2: Co-create public artworks with community participation at every stage
Host public unveiling events as community celebrations
Connect with other public art collaboratives for solidarity
level3: Support formation of additional autonomous art collaboratives
Build lasting infrastructure for community-controlled cultural expression
Advocate for policy changes supporting community-led public art

Narrative.summary: Challenge dominant narratives about who gets to tell stories in public space and reclaim art as commons.

level0: Question who gets to tell stories in your public spaces
Practice seeing art as collective meaning-making rather than individual expression
Share stories about art that has moved or changed you
level1: Identify untold stories and marginalized voices in your community
Challenge narratives of public space as commodity rather than commons
Document the collaborative art-making process publicly
level2: Create public artworks that amplify community stories and resistance
Lead community conversations about art, space, and power
Share stories about collaborative creation with broader networks
level3: Contribute to cultural shift toward viewing public art as community commons
Develop and share comprehensive analysis of art as liberation practice
Mentor others in facilitating collaborative cultural work

Knowledge.summary: Develop and share knowledge about collaborative art practices and community-controlled cultural expression.

level0: Learn about successful public art collaboratives like Trust Your Struggle
Study participatory art-making methods and community engagement practices
level1: Document your art collaborative's methods and agreements
Learn about accessibility in community art practices
level2: Host workshops on starting public art collaboratives
Create resources about Power With approaches to community art
Share knowledge with other cultural organizers and artists
level3: Develop comprehensive toolkits for collaborative public art projects
Research and document impacts of community-controlled vs top-down public art
Train facilitators in horizontal cultural organizing methods
